Rule: If the education level is at least "Bachelors", then the person is more likely to earn more than 50k $ a year.
If the work class is "Self-Employed", then the person is more likely to earn more than 50k $ a year.
If the occupation is "Professional", then the person is more likely to earn more than 50k $ a year.
If the gender is "Female", then the person is more likely to earn more than 50k $ a year.
If the number of hours worked per week is significantly different from 40 (either higher or lower), then the person is more likely to earn more than 50k $ a year.
Being Separated or Divorced can lead to higher income, as compared to being Married.
Individuals at older ages (e.g., 53) can achieve higher incomes, even while remaining in the same occupation and workclass.
